# A strict sense

The dominant philosophical movement in Germany from roughly 1870 until the First World War. ([SEP](https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/neo-kantianism))

```{mermaid} 
graph TD
K[Kuno Fischer] --> F[Gottlob Frege]
F --> C[Rudolf Carnap]
R[Heinrich Rickert] --> B[Bruno Bauch]
B --> C
W[Wm Windelband]
R --> H[Martin Heidegger]
HC[Hermann Cohen] --> EC[Ernst Cassirer]
N[Paul Natorp] --> EC
```

# A weaker sense

Rorty uses the term neokantian to assimilate all philosophers who share Kant's attitude of the [Relation of philosophy to other disciplines](/docs/phil/Relation of philosophy to other disciplines.html).
